intro: Geonoma baculifera, commonly known as the club-stalked fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen fronds that are typically less than 30 cm in length. Its rhizome is thick and club-shaped, giving the plant its common name. Geonoma baculifera thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories.
